abstract: Carl Hulse On Washington column contends failure of four gun control proposals in Senate is  predictable outcome of Congressional partisanship, inability to compromise and sway of powerful lobbyists; points out while senators in both parties agree action to prevent further gun violence is needed, political infighting will continue to prevent results.
lead_paragraph: Partisanship and the sway of special interests again prevented lawmakers this week from achieving a consensus objective over gun control measures.

headline.main: Another Impasse on Gun Bills, Another Win for Hyperpolitics
headline.print_headline: No Room for Compromise and, Again, No Room for Action

snippet: Partisanship and the sway of special interests again prevented lawmakers this week from achieving a consensus objective over gun control measures.
